DOC.brief_summary: This randomize pilot trial study well mobile health ( mHealth ) intervention work increase human papillomavirus ( HPV ) vaccination among college student Ohio State University . mHealth educational intervention may communicate information HPV vaccination increase HPV vaccine uptake college student .
DOC.brief_title: mHealth Intervention Increasing HPV Vaccinations College Students
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Pilot test mHealth HPV vaccine intervention college student establish feasibility acceptability . II . Obtain preliminary efficacy data whether mHealth HPV vaccine intervention increase HPV vaccine initiation compare control group . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Examine whether mHealth HPV vaccine intervention affect secondary outcome compare control group . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I : Participants receive target HPV vaccine narrative-style video via mobile-friendly website . Participants also receive monthly HPV vaccination reminder via email text message . ARM II : Participants receive standard information HPV HPV vaccine information statement ( VIS ) via mobile-friendly website . After completion study , participant follow 3 7 month .
DOC.criteria: Currently enrol first year Ohio State University ( OSU ) student Columbus campus Being able read English Not receive dos HPV vaccine
